document_title: Congenital heart disease: Signs of recognition, screening and treatment
subsection_content:
Congenital heart diseases are defects of the heart muscle, heart valves, and chambers that occur in the fetus and persist after birth. At this time, some heart structures will be defective, leading to the heart's activities and functions being affected. (first)
Congenital cardiovascular disease is the most common malformation, and the leading cause of death among birth defects in young children. In developed countries, the rate of children with congenital heart diseases is about 0.8 - 1% of live births.
Thanks to the development of ultrasound technology as well as the support of advanced machinery systems, the Cardiovascular Center of Tam Anh General Hospital is able to screen for congenital heart defects in children as early as the first week of life. 18 of pregnancy.
Congenital heart defects can be detected from the 18th week of pregnancy
